data.title: Wise Guy: David Chase and The Sopranos (2024)
data.meta_description: Alex Gibney delves deep into the psyche of renowned director David Chase’s life and career offering a unique window into his creative process and a deep insight into his groundbreaking work on The Sopranos.
data.text:
Felt like a behind the scene documentary you’d see on the Season 6 Blu-Ray box set - doesn’t add to what you already know but has a tiny glimpse into something so masterful, dark and meaningful to not only Chase but the entire cast and crew.

Also, TRIBECA FESTIVAL for the love of Christ and all that is holy GET BETTER MODERATORS. This is the 3rd screening where the Q&A or post discussion is not only uncomfortable but cringe worthy. How the fuck are you as a director getting AIDA’s name wrong? Chase was so right to snap back and say “you’re a documentarian, I write stories” (or something like that).

Last note: I know this is an incestuous edit…

Caught the premiere for this at the Tribeca Film Festival. The ninety minute default runtime they have on here needs to be updated because this was a meaty two and half hour documentary. Im not sure how much diehard Sopranos fans will get out of this. I never watched much behind the scenes on the show so this was pretty illuminating for me. There was certainly an ebb and flow of interesting material. The middle of the film did feel a bit middling. Most intriguing aspects were delving into David Chase’s life, how it informed the show and how unconventional he was as a storyteller for television at the time. Also seeing how the show’s success and the fame that…

The Sopranos is my favorite thing ever. Like without a shadow of a doubt my favorite piece of art ever created and it always will be. It goes well beyond just a piece of media for me. So to be at this premiere, taking a collective trip down memory lane surrounded by many of the remaining cast members and other diehard fans was really special.

David Chase is a mastermind who created the most transcendent and influential show in the history of television. It changed the entire landscape of the medium for the better. It's not like he wasn't praised nonstop during the show's run, but it's nice to know that we haven't forgotten how monumental David Chase and The…
